Event.name: Triggering
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Cause</fen> triggers a <fen>System</fen> to operate in accordance with its intended purpose. Alternatively, an <fen>Actor</fen> (acting volitionally or not) which participates in the <fen>Cause</fen>, stands in for the <fen>Cause</fen>. The <fen>System</fen> often has the capability to detect and signal the presence of an object or the occurence of an event (metal, an earthquake). It may also be or contain an explosive device. The Means by which the Cause activates the System may also be specified.
<ex><fex name="Cause">Smoking a cigarette</fex> will normally not <t>set off</t> <fex name="System">a smoke alarm</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Actor">Suspected drug traffickers</fex> <t>set off</t> <fex name="System">12 bombs</fex>, injuring 35 people.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Actor">Joseph</fex> wriggled out of the ropes and inadvertantly <t>triggered</t> <fex name="System">the burglar alarm</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Cause</fen> interacts with the <fen>System</fen> such that conditions are met for the <fen>System</fen> to operate.
<ex><fex name="cau">His presence</fex> <t>set off</t> the motion alarms.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: System
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>System</fen> interacts with or detects the <fen>Cause</fen> and activates.
<ex>They let him through even though something <t>triggered</t> <fex name="sys">the metal detector</fex>?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Means</fen> is a subevent which the <fen>Cause</fen> or <fen>Actor</fen> participates in which results in triggering the <fen>System</fen> . <ex>You must have <t>set off</t> the alarm <fex name="mea">by stepping near this sensor</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Actor
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An entity which participates in a <fen>Cause</fen>, perhaps volitionally and perhaps not.
<ex><fex name="act">She</fex> <t>set off</t> the silent alarm before being shoved into the middle of the lobby.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any holistic description of the event, including overall depictions (<ment>the same way</ment>) and descriptions pertaining to the <fen>Actor</fen>'s or <fen>Cause</fen>'s influence on the character of the event (<ment>eagerly, quietly</ment>).</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Where the triggering takes place.
<ex>Police came running downstairs when someone set off the metal detector <fex name="pla">at the county courthouse</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time when the triggering takes place.
<ex>Three bombs were <t>set off</t> <fex name="tim">at three o'clock today</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The purpose of the <fen>Actor</fen> in setting off the <fen>System</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: trigger.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause a device to activate or operate.
